page.title: 14RELIGION IRONBRIDGE
page.content: {Holy Trinity, Coalbrookdale}was built in 1854 by Abraham Darby 4 who changed from Quakerism to the Church of England. The bells at Holy Trinity were made in 1920 by Whitechapel bell foundry. In 1835{St.Lukes Church}was built on a slope in Ironbridge and it was built back to front because the slope could not take the full strain of the tower. Mr Zwalf has been vicar for 7 years. There have been 8 vicars before him at Coalbrookdale and 7 at Ironbridge. He does 2_3 jobs a day and works 6 days a week, which includes hospital visiting, and visiting a group of elderly people in the Community Centre at Sunniside. Mr Zwalf's favourite hymn is "WHEN I SURVEY THE WONDROUS CROSS".
